events.name: Material Design
events.description:
Let's dive into the new design language as promoted by Google, both for Android and the web (e.g. Polymer), namely the new Material Design philosophy and style. Professional designers at our host Appstrakt will help us understand what's new.

Preliminary Agenda:

19:00 Welcome

19:15 Material Design Concepts - Tom De Laet

20:00 MD Libraries for Android - Arne Stockmans

20:30 MD on the Web - Polymer - pjv

21:30 Bring your own design and wrap up

22:00 End

See also https://plus.google.com/events/ctkdsfouokc3ji09uks89e4kjs0

You can signup here or via the "Tickets" button at the G+ event (http://bit.ly/materialdesignbrureg)

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam - 7 sessions
events.description:
Are you interested in learning Android development in 7 sessions in 9 weeks following the Udacity online course together in Brussels? If there is enough interest we will meet weekly to follow the course and discuss the subject of the session. The course will be on 9 Tuesdays in February and March!

Please read more at http://developerstudyjams.com/

events.name: Android Testing and Android Libraries
events.description:
This event has two parts:
1) Android has a long list of libraries that make the developer's life easier. During this meeting, your favourite lib will be discussed and reviewed. It could be open or closed source. Please leave a comment below which library you would like to explain.
2) Android testing : We are happy to have a talk by Novoda about their best practices about unit testing and continuous integration.

Agenda 

19:00 Welcome and Pizza
19:30 Best practice Android testing
20:15 Bring your Android library
21:00 Social and networking
22:00 end

events.name: Go Compute!
events.description:
We have 2 main topics:

1) Compute Engine by Koen Maes:
A topic most of us know little about, even though we might know some part of Google's cloud platform like App Engine. Koen will give an expert introduction into this intricate virtual machine infrastructure and perhaps a comparison with competitors.

2) Restic (Backup tool via golang) by Alexander Neumann: 
Quite an impressive little(?) backup project. It is written in Go, and this is of course the part that we want to know more about.

Agenda

19:00 Welcome

19:30 Compute Engine

20:30 Restic

21:00 Social and networking 

22:00 end﻿

events.name: Polymer, Angular and the Web
events.description:
We're throwing ourselves back to Polymer this month, but instead of more theory, we're here to show some actual projects. There's some big things coming for Polymer in 2015.

1) My first live Polymer.dart project - Pieter-Jan Vandormael:

Competence Matrix lets you manage skills in a team. It uses Google Cloud Endpoints on AppEngine for a REST API, and Polymer and Dart for the Github-hosted frontend.

2) Requirements Bazaar (Polymer, AngularJS) - István Koren:

Requirements Bazaar 2.0 aims to be a social continuous innovation platform to bring developers and end-users together. It uses a Java backend based on microservices and an AngularJS/Polymer based Web frontend.

Agenda

19:00 Welcome

19:30 Competence Matrix

20:00 Requirements Bazaar

20:30 Social and networking

21:00 end﻿

events.name: Chromecast Code Lab (before I/O Extended)
events.description:
Before Google I/O Extended, we will work on chrome cast. Bring your laptop and have Android Studio installed.

Parking Information:

Hard to find parking in the Steenweg op Etterbeek right in front of the door, but Place Jourdan (if there is no market) or Belliardstreet often have plenty of room. Everywhere, parking is paid by ticket until 18:00, except in a short bit of the Avenue du Maelbeek. All are really close by. If these options are full, try the streets to the East. Paid parking garages are far too: Parking Forte Dei Marmi and Parking Louis Hap.

Metro or train station is Schuman.

Hard to find parking in the Steenweg op Etterbeek right in front of the door, but Place Jourdan (if there is no market) or Belliardstreet often have plenty of room. Paid parking garages are far too: Parking Forte Dei Marmi and Parking Louis Hap.

Metro or train station is Schuman.

During this reception, you’ll have the opportunity to wish fellow Google enthusiasts a “Happy New Year” and to share, learn, get inspired and engage with members of all Google related User Groups in Belgium.

events.name: Let's Learn Together: Android Things
events.description:
Hello everyone,

We'll start off 2017 with something a little bit different: let's learn together.
You may have heard of Android Things, this is what Brillo became after 2 years of silence ... Well, we don't know how it works but we want to learn, so we wanted to get together with whoever else is interested and see what we can learn from this new platform.

Here is how it's going to work: we'll bring a few Android Things compatible devices along with some breadboards, wires and LEDs. We'll have downloaded the platform and whatever else is needed on flash drives. And during the meetup we'll make a few groups, and each group will try to figure out how this works and what could be done with it.

How does that sound?
This is a very experimental new kind of meetup and we can change everything as we go along, the purpose is to learn and have fun :)

Of course, if one of you have done something with it already and would like to share, please do! :)

So because we do not have that much hardware, the places will be limited. If you really want to come please RSVP so we have an idea of people attending, and if you change your mind make sure to change your RSVP so that others can come.

Don't be afraid to use the comments to ask questions, leave suggestions and remarks about this type of event.
Also, if you have a Raspberry Pi 3 laying around not doing anything, feel free to bring it also so that we can have more hardware :)

I hope to see you there. If you have any questions

The location will be disclosed as soon as we have one!

Cheers.

Yannick

events.name: New Year's Reception
events.description:
Just like last year, all Google technologies user groups from Belgium are getting together to start the new year on the right foot.

Please follow this link to register: https://goo.gl/abPQKL. Registering on meetup will not be official, so make sure you register through the link.

Be aware that there are only 20 seats available, so register fast :)

[masked]: Food & Drinks (catering by Syrian refugee women - 'From Syria with Love’)

Hope to see you there.

events.name: Cloud Next Extended
events.description:
Google's Cloud Next conference is all about the Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, Devices, and so on.

It's over 200 sessions and the keynotes will be live streamed. So if you are interested by such an event, join us at the GooglePlex in Brussels to share the keynote streaming as well as some other sessions afterwards, or just be there for networking and discuss what was said during the keynote.

For more details, visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com.

This event is organized together with GDG Cloud and Belgaug, everybody is welcome so please RSVP with your full first and last name (security) and I hope to see you all there.

Cheers

Yannick

events.name: Let's talk about Android Architecture
events.description:
Hello guys,

This time we are very fortunate to welcome David Gonzalez (GDE !) coming directly from London to talk to us about the Android Architecture Blueprints, the github project and what they are trying to achieve with it.

This should be a great introduction to start a great conversation, so please share your own experiences and views about this topic and let's all learn a bunch of things.

Agenda:
18:00 - doors are open
18:30 - David Gonzalez about Android Architecture Blueprints
19:15 - Conversation, sharing of experience
20:30 to 21:30 - Networking with some light food and drinks

Please make sure to register with your full first and last name for security purposes.

Looking forward to seeing you all there.

Cheers,

Yannick

events.name: It is about Things, not Strings
events.description:
For this one, Kalin Maldzhanski suggested the following topic:

We all use data sources in our apps, most of it coming from "APIs" we mostly wrongly call REST. We create data models and we use Retrofit, Volley or even the new Store from NYTimes. We all use HTTP, but we actually use just the Transfer Protocol (TP) part of it.

In this meetup, we will discuss what HTTP actually is, what is REST, Semantic Web, and this idea of Linked Open Data (LOD). We will also discuss when is it useful and how can we use REST and LOD (tools and practices).

Agenda :
* 18:00 - Welcome
* 18:30 - Kalin will present the topic
* 19:30 - Discussion
* 20:30 - Networking
* 22:00 - The End

So join us and invite your friend.

As usual full first and last name please, thanks :)

Hope to see you there in numbers!

Cheers,
Yannick

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017
events.description:
Google I/O is upon us, and like every year you are invited to come join us for the keynote live stream, and more :)

You can find all the information about Google I/O on their website.

Agenda:

- 17h30: Welcome and refreshments

- 18h15: Warm up with Google and Developers Alliance  

- 19h00: Live streaming of the keynote

- 21h00: discussion and networking

- 22h30: end

Well we're still working out some details, but we know there will be food and drinks available.

Make sure to join and invite your friends!

As usual, because it happens at Google, I will need the full first and last name for all attendees, so thanks in advance to update your profile if it is not done already.

Hope to see you there, bring your friends.

Cheers,

Yannick

events.name: [Android] Advance Unit Testing
events.description:
Unit testing is a subject dear to my heart, and so is Android.
Apparently, I'm not the only one thinking so :)

This time we will have the privilege to have Jeroen Mols with us to talk about advance Mockito practices.
And I will tell you about JUnit 5 on Android.

Agenda :
* 18:30 - Welcome
* 19:00 - Jeroen Mols : Testing made Sweet with Mockito
* 20:00 - Yannick Lemin : JUnit 5 for Android --> what? why? really?
* 21:00 - Discussion and Networking
* 22:00 - The End

You know the drill, full and last name please.

I am looking forward to see you there, join and bring your friends :)

Cheers,
Yannick

events.name: [Codelabs] Android Architecture Components and Google Assistant
events.description:
Google I/O 2017 was full of great announcements, lot's of new things happening, so many things to try out and work with.

So to get started, let's do some codelabs together.
Let's do the codelabs on the new Android Architecture Components (Room, LifecycleObserver, etc) for the Android people, and the Google Assistant Codelabs for the machine learning folks.

What do you think?
So you will need:
- your laptop
- a google (gmail) account
- for Android the latest stable version of Android Studio (or the preview one if you feel adventurous)
- for Google Assistant the latest version of Chrome

As this is a codelab, we will limit the attendance to 30 people max, so please if you RSVP make sure you are coming, or leave your spot to others who would like to be there. Thanks for your understanding.

Hope to see you there !

Cheers,
Yannick :)

events.name: Kotlin Crash Course (sign up on EventBrite, link in description)
events.description:
We are happy to invite you to the first Kotlin crash course in Brussels organised by the BelKUG and GDG. For a whole day, you'll be able to learn / improve your Kotlin skills surrounded by a whole group of enthusiasts.

This course will cover an introduction to Kotlin and after the course you'll be able to start working with the language and start adding it to your own codebases. If you already know the language, we'll also offer exciting and challenging content for you which will help improve your skills.


How do I sign up?:

There are only 40 places available for the course, if you are interested in attending please sign up via Eventbrite:

CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP

Schedule:

10:00 - Open doors

10:30 - 10 min welcome and explanation presentation

10:40 - Split into groups and start of the basis / advanced theory

13:30 - Lunch break

14:30 - Codelabs

16:00 - Coffee break

19:00 - End of codelabs


Cost:

The cost of the course is 10 EUR that will be paid upon arrival at the venue. Food will be provided and drinks will be available at 1 EUR, you are of course more than welcome to bring your own drinks!


Preparations:

You should have a basic knowledge of general programming to understand concepts like classes, objects, functions, variables, loops, and so on.

You will need to bring your laptop and charger, and to gain some time make sure you have Android Studio or IntelliJ IDEA installed (make sure the kotlin plugin is already installed) before you arrive.

Hope to see you all there.

Cheers

Yannick

events.name: Augmented reality, discover ARKit, ARCore, Google Tango and HoloLens
events.description:
Augmented Reality (AR) is getting very popular this year but what is it exactly? More important how does it work? Even more crucially how can YOU explore content, build tools and solve problem with it?

This event will be a mix of presentations of the start of the art, hands on workshop and discussion in order to understand and democratize AR rather than just watch it from afar.

In collaboration with VR.Lab Brussels.

Presentations: 

• ARCore and Tango with the Unity SDK by Srinivas Rao, back from ISMAR 

• WebAR, status of the specifications, browsers and libraries (Argon/AR.js/WebARon{ARKit,ARCore,Tango}/HoloJS) by Fabien Benetou

• Beyond WebAR by Trevor Smith, Mozilla 

• Charles Boyle (aka Chuck Knowledge), co-founder and Managing Director at Signal Garden, live from SF 

• Omar Shaikh, Founder of Anstrom Tech, live from SF 

We'll do our best to have all the current commercial hardware (Lenovo Phab2Pro, Asus ZenFoneAR, Microsoft HoloLens, Samsung S8, etc).

Luckily, we'll have also a HoloLens around with a demonstration to complete the most popular platforms.

events.name: DevFest Belgium 2017
events.description:
This is the next edition of that annual conference about Google Technologies organized by the community.

Developers, Designers, Entrepreneurs, interested people are invited to join, learn, share and experiment with Android, the web, the cloud...

We will talk about Android, Web, Machine Learning, Firebase, technology, passion, experiences, and so on.

There will be theory, code labs, fun, excitement, great people, awesome ambiance, ... in other words, don't miss it :)

Hope to see you there in numbers, stay tuned for more informations very soon.

In the meantime, register :)

More info here: devfest.be

Cheers

Yannick

events.name: Machine Learning And Neural Network on Android
events.description:
For this meetup, our own Lubos, will talk about machine learning and neural network where he will introduce a new neural network API for Android.

Agenda:

18:30 Welcome

19:15 - 20:00 Neural networks API (Lubos Omelina)

20:00 - 21:00 Coffee, discussion, and networking

events.name: Open Source Software
events.description:
• What we'll do
In this meetup, Stephanie Taylor and her team from Google will be visiting us to talk about Google Summer of Code, Google Code-In and the importance of open source software.

Agenda

- 18h30: doors are open, we give some time for people to arrive
- 19h15: talk --> The importance of Open Source Software by Google's Stephanie Taylor and her team
- 20h15: networking
- 21h00: end of the event

This agenda may change, keep an eye on this space.

Also, Google will be providing some food and drinks (read here pizza and beer / soft ;) ). So thanks a lot Google for this :)

Also, because this event is happening at Google, please make sure you put your full first and last name on your meetup account for security purposes. Thanks for that :)

events.name: New year's reception @ g-company with Google tech talks
events.description:
• What we'll do
Together with g-company, Google Cloud and all the user groups, Belgaug is pleased to organise the upcoming New Year Reception at g-company in Mechelen on Wednesday, February 21st 2018.

Let’s kick off 2018 together! Besides the great Food & drinks, the atmosphere and a fantastic price we will also have an interesting 'Tech Talk' on the menu for you.

Tech Talks offer the opportunity to network with others, to share best practices and learn directly from subject matter experts from Google & customer community user group leads.

Audience: IT Professionals, interested C-Level, all members of the user groups

BelGAUG (G Suite)
GEG (Education)
Google Developers group Cloud Platform
Google Developers Group Brussels
Registration:

Due to limited capacity we would like to encourage you to only register for the event when you are sure you are able to attend!
If your organisation is not under NDA (Non-disclosure Agreement) with Google please state so in the registration form.
Please follow the link here:
https://events-belgaug.appspot.com/5756292874371072

Agenda: *Subject to change*

5:00pm - 5:30pm: Guest Registration & Welcome Drinks
5:30pm - 6:00pm: General Welcome from User Group President
6:00pm - 6:20pm: Four Communities: User Group Lead Introductions
6:20pm - 6:50pm: Endless Possibilities with Google Cloud
6:50pm - 7:30pm: Networking Bites
7:30pm - 8:00pm: Transforming Education with Technology: Bringing 21st Century Skills to the Classroom
8:00pm - 8:45pm: Interactive Event Challenge
8:45pm - 9:00pm: Closing Remarks from User Group President
9:00pm - 10:00pm: Networking Food & Drinks

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Build Actions for Google Assistant Codelab
events.description:
• What we'll do
Join us in this event if you want to learn about the Google Assistant and try to add your own touch to it.
Google is organising a Build Actions for Your Community series, and we have decided to participate with this event, to create things together. All you need to bring is your laptop.

Agenda :
- 18h30: come on over, we're about to start
- 18h45: intro as to what the Actions for Google Assistant are, and how to make them
- 19h15: we'll make teams, let's work by pair, maybe suggest some ideas
- 19h25: let's go and create things
- 21h15: we stop everything do a demo of what we've build
- 22h00: we part ways having built something that will change humanity :D

Information about setup might be sent a few days before the event if necessary, stay tuned.

So if it is something that would be of interest to you, join in. But know that places are limited, so as always I trust you guys to come if you register, and change your reservation if something come upso that we know who is coming.
Thanks for that, and see you all there !

• What to bring
laptop, motivation, good mood

• Important to know
Places are limited so please be considerate :)

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended Belgium
events.description:
Please register yourself here (instead of meetup):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeuYf_CH3Ac5Ky3O2ZEcw9MGQz7gIphK81FoxWzfV9vrXp9nA/viewform?usp=sf_link

• What we'll do
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

Come join us for an evening at GooglePlex Brussels and learn more about one of the most geek, most interesting, and most hyped topic today: deep learning networks. Particularly Google's TensorFlow framework which provides very low level entry into this space.
We'll watch sessions from the Google TensorFlow Summit 2018 and also conduct a Study Jam for anyone interested.

• What to bring
Own laptop if you'd like to participate in the study jam.
We believe that everybody will have fun and learn!

• Important to know
We'll provide pizza for dinner as well as drinks.

events.name: Android: let's talk about UI Design
events.description:
• What we'll do
Let's talk UI for a bit.
We have international speakers! We have the chance to welcome Jolanda Verhoef and Joey Kaan from Coolblue coming straight from Rotterdam to talk to use about something they have put together for their app.

And also from the Netherlands, GDE (Google Developer Expert) for Android and Product Strategy/Design, Wiebe Elsinga will come and talk to us about how to make your user happy.
Wiebe is a Lead Developer at Egeniq in The Netherlands. He has a passion for UX and design. He regularly speaks at Mobile Developer conferences, or is giving workshops.

This event is very graciously sponsored by Computer Futures (https://www.computerfutures.com).
It is a well established IT recruiting and contracting company. They are looking for new ways to bring skilled people together. With a proven track record in IT recruitment, they enjoy success within all sectors and business types. From single job vacancies to large-scale projects, their proficiency in providing exceptional professionals across the board has carved a reputation as a secure and significant supplier partner. A robust and financially strong business they have grown organically from their first office in London in 1986, to 16 offices in Europe; including Amsterdam, Antwerp, Berlin, Birmingham, Bristol, Brussels, Dublin, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, London, Manchester, Munich, Paris, Rotterdam and Stuttgart, 7 offices in the USA; including Austin, Boston, Chicago, Houston, New York, San Diego and San Francisco, and 2 in Asia Pacific; including Singapore and Tokyo.

They will provide some snacks and drinks and a great place for the event.

Agenda:
- 18h30: welcome everyone, come on over and take a seat
- 19h00: Intro and welcome
- 19h15: Jolanda Verhoef & Joey Kaan from Coolblue will tell us all about Living UI Design Systems. What are they, why do you want to use them, what makes one successful? And more interestingly, why are there no native design systems? They propose a solution and will walk you through their sample code.
- 20h30: How do you satisfy your users? How do you make your app users happy?
But who are my app users, and what do they do with my app or want to see happen?
Wiebe Elsinga will share his experience on how to satisfy your users and improve the user experience.
- 21h15: Networking
- 22h00: the end

Hope to see you there in numbers.

Cheers,
Yannick

• What to bring
Good mood is a must :)

• Important to know
Places are limited so please be considerate :)

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Brussels
events.description:
• What we'll do
That time of the year is upon us once more, Google I/O 2018 will start on May 8th and we would like to hold the yearly event so that we can all learn the new that will be announced from Google's ovens by watching the live streaming of the keynote.
And this year again we are very fortunate to be able to host this event at the awesome room in Google Brussels offices.

It will be a great time to geek out, discover what new stuff they're working on and after the keynote network and talk about all of that in a fun atmosphere and accompanied by some food and drinks, probably some swag ... and I may have heard something about some raffle at the end to win some prices, only one way to know for sure!

Agenda:
- 18h30: doors are open, welcome and have a seat
- 18h50: Michela Palladino - Developers Alliance
- 19h00: livestream of the keynote
- 20h30: food and networking + conf. call with Yannick from California
- 22h00: the end

So if you want to be part of this, register and come on over.
As usual, please update your RSVP if you can't come so that we have a good idea of who is coming, this helps us very much with the organisation.

See you there !

Cheers,
Yannick

• What to bring

• Important to know
Please make sure to have your full first and last name as they are requested by security to know they can let in or not. Thanks for your understanding.

events.name: Android: Performance with Video and Mobile Apps
events.description:
Doug Sillars is coming back to talk to us one more time about performance, this time with Video.

Agenda:
- 18:30: Doors are open
- 19:00: Doug Sillars
Its Time to Stop Stalling: Mobile App and Video Performance

Poorly performing mobile applications lead to customer frustration and abandonment. In this presentation, I'll discuss ways to deliver content to your customers quickly , no matter the network connection available. we'll look at the tools available to diagnose issues, and look at real world examples of apps that have been improved through these best practice techniques I will also focus on video streaming, as more and more apps are streaming video.
- 20:15: networking
- 21:30: The End :)

Once again, this event is very graciously sponsored by Computer Futures (https://www.computerfutures.com).
It is a well established IT recruiting and contracting company. They are looking for new ways to bring skilled people together. With a proven track record in IT recruitment, they enjoy success within all sectors and business types. From single job vacancies to large-scale projects, their proficiency in providing exceptional professionals across the board has carved a reputation as a secure and significant supplier partner. A robust and financially strong business they have grown organically from their first office in London in 1986, to 16 offices in Europe; including Amsterdam, Antwerp, Berlin, Birmingham, Bristol, Brussels, Dublin, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, London, Manchester, Munich, Paris, Rotterdam and Stuttgart, 7 offices in the USA; including Austin, Boston, Chicago, Houston, New York, San Diego and San Francisco, and 2 in Asia Pacific; including Singapore and Tokyo.

They will provide some snacks and drinks and a great place for the event.

• Important to know
Places are limited so please be considerate :)
Also if you do register and end up not being to come, please update your RSVP. Thank you.

events.name: Android Architecture Components
events.description:
• What we'll do
In this meetup, we'll talk Architecture Components on Android.

Agenda:
- 18:30: Doors are open
- 19:00: Android architecture components - how they fit in good old architectural patterns from Or Essel
Android has built in support for architecture components, such as LifeCycles, LiveData, ViewModel,Room and Paging.
Those components helps us design and manage our app architecture and abstraction.

As an Android developers, we are usually write our apps with common architecture design patterns - MVC, MVP,MVVM etc..

In this talk, I am going to talk about how to use Android's native architecture components, and combine them with those good old architecture design patterns, in order to write great apps!

- 20:15: Networking
- 21:30: The End

• Important to know
Places are limited so please be considerate :)
Also if you do register and end up not being to come, please update your RSVP. Thank you.

events.name: Hands on with TensorFlowJS
events.description:
GDG Brussels and VRLab Brussels have decided to join forces to learn more about TensorFlowJS, the machine learning library for the Web from Google.
In this meetup we will get familiar with the library, then do some exercices with it, and then finally end on a Q&A session and conclusion.

Agenda:
17h30: Doors are open, come on over
18h00: Introduction to TensorFlowJS
18h30: Hands on exercises
20h30: Conclusion
21h00: The End

Do not forget to bring your computer for the hands on, and your smile and enthusiasm.

NOTE: We are starting the talks at 18:00, with the doors opening at 17:30, so please arrive on time to ensure we run on schedule.

Thank you so much to DigitYser to help us host this event.

See you there in number!

Cheers

events.name: Android And Geek with a Drink
events.description:
Hey guys,

So the other meetup was setup a bit late, but we still want to see you guys so we'll keep the date and propose to just go have a drink instead and talk about Android or whatever other Geek stuff you want.

So let's gather at "'t Complex" bar in VUB and have a drink and chat.

See you there

Cheers

events.name: Decentralized Apps on Android, and Introduction to Flutter
events.description:
And we are back after a nice summer break.
In this meetup, our very own Friedger Müffke will come and talk to us about his new adventure with blockstack.org. And also Didier Boelens will join us to introduce Flutter.

Agenda :
18h30 - doors are open
19h00 - Opportunities in a Decentralized App World - Friedger Müffke
Cryptocurrencies, blockchain, decentralized apps are seen as new opportunities in the next era of the internet. These technologie are still at the early stage when it comes to its possibilities in the mobile world. In this session, I will give an overview of decentralized app platforms and in particular explain how to build a decentralized app with Blockstack.

Blockstack is a new internet for decentralized apps that let users own their data and maintain their privacy, security and freedom and that let developers build server-less apps.

Please make sure to prepare the session by creating a blockstack ID at https://blockstack.org/install/

20h00 - What is Flutter? Why should we consider it and when? - Didier Boelens

20h45 - Networking
21h30 - The end :)

We are hoping to see you there in numbers.

events.name: What are the limitations of your smartphone camera
events.description:
In this meetup Lubos will explain different aspects that you should keep in mind when processing images on smartphones. Hopefully you will learn how to analyze your image processing use-case before writing any algorithms. This might be particularly useful when writing your deep learning algorithm, to make sure the use-case is viable on the phones.
I will present it from the perspective of using eye tracking on smartphones.

Agenda :
18h30 - doors are open
19h00 - What are the limitations of your smartphone camera?

20h00 - Networking
20h45 - The end :)

I hope to see an interesting discussion with a lot of you after the presentation.

events.name: Let's coroutine all the things together
events.description:
The Belgian Kotlin User Group and GDG Brussels are at it again to co-organise a hands-on session about Kotlin.
One of the hot Kotlin topic currently is: coroutines.

For this session, we will briefly explain what coroutines are, and for anyone that have never played with it, follow the "Using Kotlin Coroutines in your Android App" codelab provided by Google. The idea is to do this together and help each other understand how these things work.
For the more advanced coroutines experts amongts yourselves, just come over and bring your own projects, ask questions, share the knowledge, help each other.

Let's learn together by making !

Thanks very much to Cowboy (https://cowboy.com/) which are kind enough to let us invade their offices for this event.

As this is a joint event, please register on this eventbrite event page
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/lets-coroutine-all-the-things-together-tickets-55723372106

events.name: Geek & Drinks
events.description:
"All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy"

Isn't that right? We, at least, couldn't agree more and we see the GDG not only as an opportunity to share our passion but also to spend time with you (yes, *you*) and talk about geeky stuff, you know, the things we always do in the cold after 10pm when the meetup is over! Well, why not do that around a drink?!

So you are all invited to come and join us for a drink (or two) and we'll try a fun experiment with you all. So don't be shy and join us because the more the merrier :)

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Brussels
events.description:
On May the 7th, Google is hosting its biggest event of the year (aka Google IO) in Mountain View where they will announce everything they have been working for the past year. To celebrate the occasion and share that moment with you, we are hosting a Google IO Extended, here in Brussels! We are hosted by Google in the fantastic Nine-One incubator.

• What we'll do
We'll have a drink and some food while we are watching the main keynote.
Then, we'll take time after the keynote to network and talk about all the new shiny stuff that Google will announce!

Oh! We forgot to tell you! There will be some swags for every participant and some lucky winners will also leave with an extra gift! \o/

Agenda:
- 18h30: doors are open, welcome and have a seat
- 18h55: live stream of the keynote
- 20h30: food and networking
- 22h00: the end

So if you want to be part of this, hurry up to register as we can only host a 100 people!
As usual, please update your RSVP if you can't come so that someone else can take your spot. That's really appreciated!

See you there !

• Important to know
Please make sure to have your full first and last name as they are requested by security to know they can let in or not. Thanks for your understanding.

events.name: [Flutter] Codelab
events.description:
The sun is shining (Well, sometimes, I mean we are still in Belgium, right? ¯\_(ツ)_/¯) and the birds are tweeting. Long story short, the holiday season is getting closer!
Nevertheless, we have not forgotten about you and we have planned one last event before the holidays (don't worry, we'll be back in September!)

We offer you to meet us in the nice Weber room of the VUB to take on the challenge of learning more about Flutter. Let's follow a codelab together and push the limits of Flutter to learn more about this emerging technology.

During the event, you'll be able to follow the codelab at your own pace and get help from the organizers and from other participants. The event is completely free, as usual, and you can leave whenever you want.

Interested? Great! Meet us on Monday 24th of June at the VUB with your laptop (even better if Flutter is already installed https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install but if it isn't, we'll help you through it during the event :) ) and happy coding together!

We can't wait to see you there!

Psssst! If you are already familiar with Flutter and already fell in love with it, don't pass on the occasion to come and help others feel the Flutter love :)

events.name: Android: What's new in AR/VR
events.description:
During this meetup, we'll have two speakers.

The first speaker, Fabien Bénétou, from VR.Lab Brussels, will talk about what is the current state of VR, how is it used in the industry and what we can expect from it in the future.

The second part will focus on AR, Benjamin will give a talk about how to start a project using Google Play Services for AR (previously AR Core) and what are the different possibilities offered by the library.

Agenda
- 18:30: Welcome people
- 19:00: Fabien will talk about VR
- 20:00: Benjamin will talk about AR
- 21:00: Discussions
- 21:30: End of the event

upcoming.name: Android: Successfully modularising your app with Jeroen Mols
upcoming.description:
Jeroen Mols will join us for this meetup and presents his talk about modularizing apps.

Here is the description of his talk :
Modularizing your app seems to be all the hype these days. But why should you actually care? What are the benefits for you and your team? How should a modularized app look like? And how do you start splitting your app?

In this talk you will learn why modularization matters and how a modularized architecture looks like. We’ll study a real-life example project and investigate how modules are setup, organized and configuration is shared across modules. Finally you’ll learn how you can start modularizing your existing app and I’ll share what lessons we learned while doing so at Philips Hue.

Agenda:
- 18:30: Welcome
- 19:00: Jeroen will present his talk
- 20:00: Discussions
- 21:00: End

Once again, this event is very graciously sponsored by Computer Futures (https://www.computerfutures.com).
It is a well established IT recruiting and contracting company. They are looking for new ways to bring skilled people together. With a proven track record in IT recruitment, they enjoy success within all sectors and business types. From single job vacancies to large-scale projects, their proficiency in providing exceptional professionals across the board has carved a reputation as a secure and significant supplier partner. A robust and financially strong business they have grown organically from their first office in London in 1986, to 16 offices in Europe; including Amsterdam, Antwerp, Berlin, Birmingham, Bristol, Brussels, Dublin, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, London, Manchester, Munich, Paris, Rotterdam and Stuttgart, 7 offices in the USA; including Austin, Boston, Chicago, Houston, New York, San Diego and San Francisco, and 2 in Asia Pacific; including Singapore and Tokyo.

They will provide some snacks and drinks and a great place for the event.
Thank you very Computer Futures for helping us with this event.

group_profile.intro: Developer since 2004, I have grown fond of the little green robot since I started tinkering with it in 2011. I currently work at Emakina as lead Android developer where I like to focus on code quality and maintainability.
